column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Seven coronavirus-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Tuesday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 748 cases of coronavirus were reported on Tuesday
column5: 764 on Monday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.A total of 210
column7: 729 cases of the virus have been confirmed in Northern Ireland since the pandemic began.There are 461 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals
column8: up from 407 on Monday.There are 45 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units
column9: down from 46 on Monday.Thirty five of those with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units are on ventilators.Last updated 7 September at 14:00 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column11: 155 Covid-19 vaccines have been administered in Northern Ireland.Of those
column17: 318 are second doses. A total of 1
column18: 714 doses were administered on Monday.Last updated 7 September at 14:00 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandNo coronavirus-related deaths were recorded in the Republic of Ireland on Tuesday.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5

column22: 470 new cases of coronavirus were reported on Tuesday
